title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins GM Don Sweeney expresses optimism about the team's competitiveness for the 2025-26 season despite last year's struggles.
The Bruins will start the season without a set captain, allowing leadership to develop organically, according to Don Sweeney.
Young players are expected to compete for roster spots, with prospects like Fraser Minten and Matt Poitras vying for roles.

title: These 5 New England restaurants make best 50 list from NYT
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five New England restaurants made The New York Times' list of the 50 best in the U.S.
Boston's McGonagle's pub and La Padrona Back Bay Italian restaurant are new entrants to the list.
Maine's Pilgrim's Inn and Sammy’s Deluxe, plus Connecticut's Haring’s, also featured on the list.

title: Patriots reportedly cut ‘training camp star’ DJ James
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots waive cornerback DJ James after a strong preseason and limited play in season opener.
Drafted by Seattle, James joined New England's practice squad last year before making the 53-man roster.
James recorded notable performances in training camp but played only two defensive snaps against the Raiders.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may get married in Rhode Island. Here’s everything we know about the possible wedding plans.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly planning a wedding in Rhode Island by the end of 2026.
The couple may hold their wedding at Swift's Holiday House in Westerly, R.I., according to multiple media sources.
Swift and Kelce announced their engagement on Instagram with plans for a private ceremony, potentially next summer.

title: 2 cyclists medflighted after Mass. crashes
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 63-year-old cyclist in Gloucester was medflighted with serious injuries after being hit by a car on Washington St.
In Norwood, a 15-year-old cyclist was medflighted with nonlife-threatening injuries following a crash on Walpole Street.
Both crashes involve ongoing investigations, with no charges expected for the Norwood incident, says Police Chief Christopher Padden.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague released from jail
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: North Andover officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons, charged with assault, was released on house arrest without seeing her infant son.
Fitzsimmons claimed she tried to harm herself, not others, during a June confrontation with police following a restraining order.
Fitzsimmons must wear GPS monitoring and abide by specific conditions set by Superior Court Judge Kathleen McCarthy-Neyman.

title: N.H. woman indicted for allegedly distributing ‘animal crush’ videos
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lynn Seymour, 51, of Manchester, N.H., indicted for distributing animal crush videos, faces federal charges.
Seymour accused of administering online groups for sharing videos depicting monkey torture, potentially serving seven years in prison.
Court ordered Seymour to attend a mental health program and barred her from unauthorized computer use and possessing animals.

title: Tom Brady talks Netflix roast, ‘most rewarding’ Super Bowl win on Kevin Hart’s ‘Cold as Balls’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady spoke with Kevin Hart for the 100th episode of 'Cold as Balls,' revealing his 'most rewarding' Super Bowl win.
Brady considers his Buccaneers' Super Bowl victory his 'most rewarding' and praised his relationship with Bill Belichick.
Discussing young quarterbacks, Brady highlighted Patrick Mahomes' potential while noting increased distractions in today's game.

title: What issues are most important to you in the Boston mayoral, City Council election?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston's preliminary election held on Sept. 9 to advance mayoral and City Council candidates to the Nov. 4 general election.
Voter concerns include housing affordability, public safety, immigration policies, and infrastructure in the upcoming Boston election.
Residents express issues with high rent and safety, notably in areas like Mass and Cass affecting their city living experience.

title: Mass. has one of the best nude beaches in the U.S., according to CNN
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Moshup Beach on Martha’s Vineyard named one of the top nude beaches in the U.S. by CNN.
Located on Martha's Vineyard, Moshup Beach combines clothing-optional sections with scenic cliffs and surfing opportunities.
Moshup Beach visitors can also explore nearby attractions like Gay Head Lighthouse and Aquinnah Cultural Center.
